# Global Government Medical Research Spending: The Pathetic Truth

Here's the complete accounting of humanity's commitment to curing disease. Spoiler: It's embarrassing.

## The Global Total: $68 Billion (A Rounding Error)

In 2024, all governments on Earth combined spent approximately **[$68 billion](../references.qmd#global-gov-med-research-spending)** on medical research. 

For context:

- Global military spending: **[$2.7 trillion](../references.qmd#sipri-2024-spending)** (40X more)
- Global GDP: **[$105 trillion](../references.qmd#global-gdp)** (we spend 0.065% on not dying)
- Annual pet food sales: **[$150 billion](../references.qmd#annual-pet-food-sales-150b)** (dogs eat better than researchers)
- Single US aircraft carrier: **[$13 billion](../references.qmd#us-aircraft-carrier-cost-13b)** (one boat = 19% of global medical research)

## Country-by-Country Breakdown: The Hall of Shame

### United States: The Alleged Leader

**NIH Budget (2024): [$47.1 billion](../references.qmd#nih-budget-fy2025)**

Breakdown:

- National Cancer Institute: [$7.22 billion](../references.qmd#nih-institute-budgets-fy24) (less than one stealth bomber)
- National Institute on Aging: [$4.41 billion](../references.qmd#nia-budget-4-41b) (we spend more on botox)
- All other institutes: $35.47 billion (combined)

**But wait, there's less!**

- [31% goes to "administrative costs"](../references.qmd#nih-administrative-costs-31pct) (bureaucrats need yachts)
- Universities steal [40-60% as "indirect costs"](../references.qmd#university-indirect-costs-40-60pct) (new football stadiums)
- Actual research: Maybe $20 billion if we're generous

**Per American:**

- Military spending: [$3,000/year](../references.qmd#us-per-capita-military-spending-3000)
- Medical research: $142/year
- Ratio: 21:1 for death over life

## The Breakdown by Disease: Where the Pennies Go

### Global Disease-Specific Funding (Approximate)

**Cancer:** [~$5.5 billion/year](../references.qmd#global-cancer-research-spending-20b) (public/philanthropic funding; [$7.2B from NCI alone](../references.qmd#global-cancer-research-spending))

- Sounds like a lot until you do the math
- Divided by [10.4 million annual deaths](../references.qmd#cancer-deaths-10m-annually)
- = $529 per death to maybe prevent it
- A basic cancer screening costs more

**Heart Disease:** [~$8 billion globally](../references.qmd#global-heart-disease-spending-8b)

- Kills [18 million annually](../references.qmd#death-causes-vs-fear)
- = $444 per death
- A nice dinner costs more

**Infectious Diseases:** [~$12 billion](../references.qmd#global-infectious-disease-spending-12b)

- Mostly after pandemics start
- Preparation budget: ~$0
- "Surprised Pikachu face" budget: Unlimited

**Mental Health:** [~$3 billion globally](../references.qmd#global-mental-health-spending-3b)

- Depression affects [280 million](../references.qmd#depression-prevalence-280m)
- = $10.71 per suffering person
- Therapy session: $200
- Math: Depressing

**Rare Diseases:** [~$6.9 billion (NIH alone)](../references.qmd#global-rare-disease-research-spending-6b)

- [400 million people affected](../references.qmd#rare-disease-prevalence-400m)
- = $17.25 per person
- Still less than a cheap pizza
- Your rare disease child: Worth less than lunch

**Aging Research:** [~$500 million globally](../references.qmd#global-aging-research-spending-500m)

- Everyone ages (citation needed)
- Everyone dies from it
- Investment: Basically zero
- Anti-aging creams: [$50 billion](../references.qmd#anti-aging-cream-market-50b) (10X more)

## The Purchasing Power Parity Excuse (And Why It's BS)

"But China's $15 billion goes further than America's $47 billion!"

Cool story. Let's check:

- [Chinese researcher salaries: 1/2 to 1/3 of American (average $38K-43K vs $89K-130K)](../references.qmd#china-vs-us-researcher-salary)
- MRI machine: Costs the same everywhere
- Microscope: Also same price
- Actual impact: Maybe 2X more efficient, not 5X
- Still pathetic: Absolutely

## Historical Trend: Getting Worse

**Global Medical Research as % of GDP:**

- 1960: 0.12%
- 1980: 0.10%
- 2000: 0.08%
- 2024: 0.065%

We're literally investing LESS in not dying as we get richer. It's like evolution in reverse.

## What $68 Billion Actually Buys

**Current Reality:**

- [50 new drugs approved annually](../references.qmd#global-new-drug-approvals-50-annually) (most are me-too drugs)
- [0 diseases cured since Hepatitis C (2014)](../references.qmd#diseases-cured-since-2014)
- [95% of diseases](../references.qmd#95-pct-diseases-no-treatment): Still no treatment
- Time to develop one drug: [17 years](../references.qmd#drug-development-timeline-17-years)
- Success rate: [0.01%](../references.qmd#drug-development-success-rate-0-01pct)

**What It Could Buy (If Spent Efficiently):**

- 54,000 pragmatic trials (at $500K each)
- Testing 1 million treatments simultaneously
- Curing 10-20 diseases annually
- But no: Bureaucracy needs feeding
